text: Follow Gepard Landau to the Guardian's residence

title: Mission Description
content: The bad news is that your buddySampohas abandoned you and left you to deal with Gepard Landau, the Silvermane Guard Captain, alone. The good news, however, is that the imposing soldier is actually quite flexible.You successfully persuade Gepard by making him believe that you are from a world beyond the sky. He promises to escort you to the Supreme Guardian atBelobog.Everything looked perfect... There's no reason for doubt, all you have to do is follow the Silvermane Guards.

text: (If the player walks away from Gepard)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (The guards will notice if we stray too far off... We should stick close to Gepard.)

speaker: Dan Heng
line: We saw strange creatures outside the city... They must have come from a tear in corroded space. A Fragmentum , correct?

speaker: Gepard
line: How do you... That's right. Out there in the blizzard, there are still many threats... including the monsters you saw.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Monsters of that type rarely venture outside the Fragmentum... meaning the corrosion affecting your planet is already very serious.

speaker: Gepard
line: The Silvermane Guards are continuously engaged with the enemy, but I'm afraid the situation is bleak... After your meeting with the supreme guardian, I would like to consult you on this matter. *sigh* We're lacking in intel.

text: (Child citizen comments during walk, idle text)

speaker: Kid That Idolizes Gepard
line: Look, Captain Gepard's back!

speaker: Kid That Idolizes Gepard
line: So impressive... I want to become as strong a Silvermane Guard as him!

text: (Performer citizen comments during walk, idle text)

speaker: Excitable Citizen
line: What happened? Seems serious...

speaker: Excitable Citizen
line: Who are those guys behind the captain? Look at their attire, so strange...

speaker: Nosy Citizen
line: Say, the officer that you were speaking to... was that Gepard Landau?

children.speaker: Nosy Citizen
children.line: Argh, I knew it was him — I wasn't brave enough to go over. I should've tried to stop him.

children.speaker: Nosy Citizen
children.line: Captain Gepard is wise and decisive, and of noble birth... I'm sure he'd help me.

text: What do you make of him?

children.speaker: Nosy Citizen
children.line: What do I make of him? Why, he's a captain of the Silvermane Guards — not to mention of noble birth! I mean, he's a Landau !

children.speaker: Nosy Citizen
children.line: If I could just find a way to tell him about my situation, I'm sure he'd help me.

speaker: Nosy Citizen
line: *sigh* I'm getting ahead of myself, I already missed my chance... back to the queue I guess.

speaker: Worried Citizen
line: What am I gonna do? Only the Madam Guardian can help me...

speaker: Aggressive Citizen
line: Hey, you got a problem? If you wanna petition then start queuing. Don't even think about pushing in.

speaker: Aggrieved Citizen
line: This queue isn't moving, how long are we gonna be here...

speaker: Gepard
line: We're here.

speaker: Gepard
line: This is Qlipoth Fort , the heart of Belobog and headquarters of the Architects .

children.speaker: Gepard
children.line: Qlipoth is the symbol of Preservation . Under Qlipoth's impulsion, the Architects constructed Belobog, thus protecting the spark of civilization from disaster and the Eternal Freeze .

children.speaker: Gepard
children.line: To show our reverence, we named this fortress after the Aeon themself. The Architects, under the protection of Qlipoth, have continued to lead this city forward, repelling all manner of disasters.

children.speaker: Gepard
children.line: The saviors of humanity. Long before the arrival of the Eternal Freeze, the Architects braved the doubts and derision of the people, never wavering from their construction of its defenses. History has proven that their decision was the correct one.

children.speaker: Gepard
children.line: The Architects named this fortress after Qlipoth, Aeon of Preservation. Under their direction, humanity has withstood external enemy attacks and held off the Eternal Freeze. Even today, we resist the Fragmentum's corrosion.

speaker: Gepard
line: This fortress is also the residence of the supreme guardian.

speaker: March 7th
line: The supreme guardian?

speaker: Gepard
line: The leader of Belobog, elected and appointed by the Architects. The supreme guardians have watched over this city for generations, sheltering the people from harm.

speaker: Gepard
line: The current guardian is Madam Cocolia Rand . Every major strategic decision is issued by her.

speaker: March 7th
line: Whoa... she sounds like a big deal.

speaker: Gepard
line: I will now bring you to see Madam Cocolia. Please have your words at the ready. Her time is precious, so she prefers concise communication.

speaker: March 7th
line: Uhh... We're gonna see her right now? Can I at least find a place to freshen up first?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Let's not waste time. No one will notice.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: You've got some snow in your hair, but no one will notice.

text: Is there any etiquette we need to observe?

children.speaker: Gepard
children.line: Rest easy, the Madam Guardian doesn't care about formalities. Not to mention, you've only just arrived, it would be unexpected if you were familiar with Belobog customs.

speaker: Gepard
line: I've dispatched a messenger to send word, Madam Cocolia will be aware of your arrival. Come with me.

speaker: Bronya
line: ...But that's a meaningless sacrifice, how can you—

speaker: Cocolia
line: Ahem... You may leave, Bronya. Visitors have arrived.

speaker: Bronya
line: Yes, mother.

speaker: Gepard
line: Madam Guardian, I have brought three outsiders to see you.

speaker: Cocolia
line: The messenger informed me. Well done, Gepard. You may leave.

speaker: Cocolia
line: Welcome, visitors from beyond the Eternal Freeze. Or perhaps I should say: From beyond the sky... no?

speaker: Cocolia
line: I am Cocolia Rand, Belobog's supreme guardian. I would be grateful if you could tell me why you have come.

text: So you don't doubt our identity?
So you believe we come from beyond the sky?

speaker: Cocolia
line: Do you wish me to doubt it? Or perhaps you're not confident in that identity yourself? Haha... No, I do not doubt it. I can see that you are not from this world.

speaker: Cocolia
line: The Architects remember the history well, else we should forget it. I know that in the distant past, before the Eternal Freeze descended or the Legion invaded, this world was once prosperous beyond measure...

speaker: Cocolia
line: An Aeon connected our planet to other worlds, and we discovered the endless possibilities of the boundless universe. We also came to know of Qlipoth, the Amber Lord. Under THEIR attentive gaze, we built the city walls.

speaker: Cocolia
line: ...So, do not be surprised. For seven hundred years, the Architects have received no further communication from the stars... but I knew of your existence. Tell me why you have come.

text: We've come to trailblaze this planet.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: ...Do you think anyone's gonna know what you're talking about?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: We came here for something known as a Stellaron .

speaker: Cocolia
line: A Stellaron?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Objects that fell from the blue on separate worlds. Their appearance spelled disaster. Many of the planets we've visited have suffered their effects.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: You mentioned invasion by the Antimatter Legion. Soon after their arrival, this planet suffered the Eternal Freeze. At the same time, the phenomenon known as Fragmentum space corrosion began to occur. Correct?

speaker: Cocolia
line: ...Correct.

text: The Stellarons were cast by the Aeon of Destruction .

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Which is why the Antimatter Legion and Stellarons often show up together! Worlds seeded with Stellarons give birth to Fragmentums. As for the Eternal Freeze... it must have been a product of the Stellaron — unique to the environment of your world.

text: The Eternal Freeze is a product of the Stellaron.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Stellarons bring about different disasters on different worlds. But every world seeded with a Stellaron will give birth to Fragmentums.

text: Fragmentums are a product of the Stellaron.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Stellarons bring about different disasters on different worlds. But every world seeded with a Stellaron will give birth to Fragmentums.

speaker: March 7th
line: You can see us as... kindhearted interstellar public servants, lending a helping hand to any world affected by a Stellaron!

speaker: Cocolia
line: Your analysis of our current circumstances is clear. We have indeed suffered the disasters you speak of, some of which prove vexatious to us even today... but why should you care?

speaker: Cocolia
line: Even if this Stellaron you speak of did bring about disaster, I fail to see its connection to you. I don't believe that anyone would go to such lengths to help a world unrelated to them... unless they had something to gain.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: You're right. Our reason for coming here is not purely selfless. If we don't seal the Stellaron, we cannot leave this planet.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Yeah! FYI, we're pretty awesome.

text: Please help us locate the Stellaron.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: If we can get rid of it, your world will be safer too!

speaker: Cocolia
line: You... know how to seal the "Stellaron"?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: We have the relevant means.

speaker: Cocolia
line: Very well, I believe you. If our present situation is truly the result of this so-called Stellaron, then your arrival is the hope that Belobog has waited seven hundred years for. I am willing to assist you in any way possible to help you locate the Stellaron.

speaker: Cocolia
line: It's getting late, and you must be tired. I will arrange for you to stay in our most comfortable hotel. Rest there, and get a good night's sleep. Tomorrow, at noon, I will dispatch someone to escort you here, and we can discuss this urgent matter in greater detail.

children.speaker: Cocolia
children.line: It should be me thanking you, visitors from beyond the sky.

text: We'd like to take a look around.

children.speaker: Cocolia
children.line: But of course. You are Belobog's honored guests, and have the highest privileges afforded to you.

speaker: Cocolia
line: I too need some time. I will go over our records for anything that may be connected to Stellarons... Please excuse me for not escorting you further.

text: (The Trailblazer, March 7th, and Dan Heng leave, with the Trailblazer briefly glancing back at a strange noise before exiting)

speaker: Cocolia
line: ...Of course I understand.

speaker: Cocolia
line: Do not worry, I have a way.

speaker: Gepard
line: It seems that the supreme guardian holds you in high regard. I have received orders that your movements are no longer to be restricted.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: She's the big shot! Definitely got that "queen of the castle" vibe going on. Aww, so cool.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Y'know, I didn't think things were gonna go that smoothly.

speaker: Gepard
line: Haha. I'm afraid I still have duties to attend to. I must return to my post. I hope you enjoy your stay in Belobog.

speaker: March 7th
line: Wait! Can you recommend some sights? It's not that late, we wanna take a look around.

speaker: Gepard
line: Well, I'd say that Golden Theater and the History Museum are both worth a look. However, you'd need a pass to get into the museum.

speaker: Gepard
line: I recommend you visit Everwinter Monument first — it's Belobog's most symbolic landmark.

speaker: Gepard
line: And if you enjoy music, you could head to Neverwinter Workshop . You can sometimes catch an outdoor performance there. The artist is... *sigh* You'll see.

speaker: Gepard
line: Oh, and if you're staying at Goethe Hotel , please avoid the alley that runs next to it — the one with Silvermane Guards stationed there. It started to be affected by corrosion recently, so it's been sealed off.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: So the corrosion is inside the city... that's a grave situation.

speaker: Gepard
line: Yes, we're mounting a resistance as we speak. I must leave now, I hope all goes well for you.

title: Mission Description
content: The Captain's words linger: The steadfast Architects built this Towering Citadel. Belobog remains forever warm in the face of unrelenting cold...His tone was strange, as if he was quoting a historical record, and made a deep impression on you... Hopefully, this doesn't ruin your enjoyment of the fancy hotel's fluffly mattress.There's still some time before nightfall. Why don't you take a tour around the ancient city in the meantime?

speaker: March 7th
line: Neverwinter Workshop... Hey! Didn't Gepard say there'd be a show here?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: He said "you can sometimes catch an outdoor performance..." "Sometimes" being the operative word.

speaker: March 7th
line: Darn, I wanted to see one...

speaker: March 7th
line: Oh — I've been wondering — you see that heater over there? Why do they keep it outdoors? This city is so weird...

speaker: March 7th
line: Normally you'd want a heater INSIDE a building, right?

text: Is this how they repel the Eternal Freeze?

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: ...If so, I'm not sure "mighty" is the right word for these Architects.

text: Maybe they have indoor heaters too.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Maybe, but the ones outside just seem like a waste of energy.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: *gasp* Maybe this is how the Architects repel the Eternal Freeze!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Tiny heaters are no use against a Stellaron disaster.

speaker: Distinctively-Dressed Woman
line: Hah, you guys sure have a lot to say about that broken heater.

speaker: March 7th
line: Oh wow — she's cool!

children.speaker: Distinctively-Dressed Woman
children.line: Hi there. The name's Serval, I'm the owner of this workshop.

children.speaker: Distinctively-Dressed Woman
children.line: Yep, touch it and find out — ice cold. I was just about to fix it up.

children.speaker: Distinctively-Dressed Woman
children.line: I forgot to introduce myself. The name's Serval, I'm the owner of this workshop.

speaker: Serval
line: If you got any broken equipment lying around you can always come find me, though I can't guarantee I'll be interested in fixing it.

speaker: March 7th
line: Oh, we're okay, I was just curious about the heater...

speaker: Serval
line: Curious? About the heater? It's just a standard Geomarrow radiator — you can find them anywhere in the Administrative District .

text: We only just got here — everything's new to us.

children.speaker: Serval
children.line: ...Only just got here?

text: Standing broken machines outside a workshop is bad advertising.

children.speaker: Serval
children.line: Huh? What's wrong with that? Everyone around here knows the way I work...

speaker: Serval
line: Ah! I've figured it out! I heard a loudmouthed guard say that a group of outsiders had met with Cocolia... You must be them?

speaker: Serval
line: What an honor! Where are my manners — we can talk about heaters all day if you like. Let's have a chat~

speaker: Serval
line: The heater you saw is just a standard Geomarrow radiator. They may not look like much, but they're a real lifeline to the people.

speaker: Serval
line: The blizzards here are brutal. If we didn't have a reliable way of keeping warm, Belobog would long since have become a dead city — both above and below the surface.

children.speaker: Serval
children.line: It's an ore — a special energy resource. Whether it's keeping the city warm or keeping our counters ticking, everything runs on Geomarrow.

children.speaker: Serval
children.line: Geomarrow grows beneath the surface of the planet, and specialist Underworld mining teams are there to extract it. Transport lines shuttle it up to the surface. In the Overworld , we use the same lines to ship surface goods and aid down to the Underworld.

children.speaker: Serval
children.line: You didn't know? Belobog is structured like two big connected discs. The Overworld is responsible for administration and trade, while the Underworld is responsible for energy supply and resource extraction.

children.speaker: Serval
children.line: However, due to an order that was given many years ago, nobody has moved between the Overworld and the Underworld in a long time.

children.speaker: Serval
children.line: ...Ah! I shouldn't be talking about this. Pretend I never said anything.

children.speaker: Serval
children.line: Isn't it just like cooking food over an open flame? If the house is a pot, then the heater is the stove it rests on.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: When she puts it like that, it actually starts to make sense...

speaker: Serval
line: No sweat. This is your first time in Belobog — I just want you to feel some of the warmth the city has to offer.

speaker: Serval
line: Hey, seeing as there's nothing on your plate just now, wanna help me fix up this machine? Just a bit of manual labor — you might find it interesting.

speaker: Serval
line: Great! Then let me give you a demonstration first.

text: (Interact with the machine, opensMagnetorheological Fluid Threshold Tutorial)

Rotate the modules to adjust the circuit and direct the electrical current from the power supply to the end point . Repairs are complete when all end point circuits are connected to the current. Rotate the modules to adjust the circuit and direct the electrical current from the power supply to the end point . Repairs are complete when all end point circuits are connected to the current. The edges of fixed modules will appear red when selected. The edges of fixed modules will appear red when selected.

children.text: This is the source from which the electric current flows out
This is the end that can be unlocked after receiving enough electric current
Rotate the module and change the circuit to connect the electric current

text: (Talk to Serval after fixing the machine)

speaker: Serval
line: Nice! You guys are pretty handy — you picked that up in no time. Wanna be my assistants? Average pay, but I'm a good boss.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Hah — do you just say yes to everything?

speaker: Serval
line: Hahaha, I was only kidding — just a joke.

speaker: Serval
line: Well, I'd better carry on here, why not have a better look around? My workshop will always be open to you... and your wallets, of course.

text: See what's around the Goethe Hotel

speaker: March 7th
line: Ah, that's the alley that Gepard mentioned — the one contaminated by the Fragmentum, right?

speaker: March 7th
line: I can't believe how close it is to the city center...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: If they hadn't identified it, I bet all the shops and hotels in the vicinity would have had to close down by now.

speaker: Stern Silvermane Guard
line: Move back! This is your final warning!

speaker: Distressed Citizen
line: But... B—But my proof of property is inside. I don't have any—

speaker: Stern Silvermane Guard
line: The Fragmentum has already corroded this block! You can make a property retrieval request to the Architects, but only Silvermane Guards are permitted to enter here!

speaker: March 7th
line: I can't believe Fragmentum corrosion has spread into the city... No wonder there are so many soldiers stationed there.

text: This world really is in dire straits.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: It sure is... but at least we're here. Once we seal the Stellaron, they can get back to the good life.

text: Can soldiers really hold back the Fragmentum?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: No. As long as the Stellaron is active, the corrosion will continue to spread.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: The soldiers can only periodically clear the Fragmentum of monsters. But the monsters will continue to emerge and multiply.

speaker: Composed Silvermane Guard
line: Please try to understand, sir. Backwater Pass has become very dangerous. We're just here for your safety.

speaker: Distressed Citizen
line: If I can't get my proof of property, it doesn't matter how safe I am! Out of my way — let me pass...

speaker: Silvermane Guard
line: *sigh*

speaker: Stern Silvermane Guard
line: Stand back! This area is off limits — only Silvermane Guards are permitted to enter here!

text: Are the Guards able to control the situation?

children.speaker: Composed Silvermane Guard
children.line: We're optimistic — this area has only recently been corroded, so monsters are few and far between. Please, have faith in the Guards.

children.speaker: Stern Silvermane Guard
children.line: If it weren't for most of our forces being deployed to the front line, situations like this wouldn't amount to anything! We can't even go on the offensive.

children.speaker: Composed Silvermane Guard
children.line: It used to be a transport hub... but it's been closed down.

children.speaker: Stern Silvermane Guard
children.line: Darn monsters!

text: This must be a hard job.

children.speaker: Composed Silvermane Guard
children.line: Well, this is our duty as Silvermane Guards. We are responsible for the safety of the citizenry.

children.speaker: Stern Silvermane Guard
children.line: Duty is duty — we trust in the higher-ups! But I worry about our compatriots below ground. They must be—

children.speaker: Composed Silvermane Guard
children.line: That's enough, the guardian has strictly forbidden discussion of Underworld affairs...

children.speaker: Stern Silvermane Guard
children.line: Right! I'm such a hothead. I'll zip it!

text: I don't have any more questions.

children.speaker: Composed Silvermane Guard
children.line: Please keep a safe distance, this is a live situation. Plus, we need to look busy.

speaker: Distressed Citizen
line: Let me pass! I'm not afraid to die! I've lost everything... everything...

speaker: March 7th
line: Wow, look at the carved ice! It feels perfect for this city, somehow.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Whatever it's made of, it can't be ice.

speaker: March 7th
line: I guess you're right, it's actually pretty warm in the city... Hey, what's with all the children over there? Should we go and take a look?

speaker: Girl in Silvermane Guard Uniform
line: So, let me introduce myself. I'm the Intelligence Officer for the Silvermane Guards, and a temporary guide for the "A Journey Through Belobog's History" program. My name is Pelageya Sergeyevna.

speaker: Pela
line: But you can call me Pela.

speaker: Children
line: Yes~ Miss~ Pela~

children.speaker: Pela
children.line: ...And perhaps the grownups among us could refrain from acting like children?

children.speaker: Pela
children.line: ...And perhaps the grownups among us could remain silent? This is a children's program...

speaker: Pela
line: Okay guys, take a look over here: This is Everwinter Monument. It was erected to commemorate the mighty Architects.

speaker: Pela
line: The Architects are followers of the Aeon Qlipoth. It was they that foresaw crisis, built up our walls, and established Belobog — preserving the spark of human civilization. Even today, they are still tending to the city.

speaker: Pela
line: Everwinter Monument is made up of two parts: A gear that symbolizes knowledge and industrial strength, and huge ice crystals that symbolize the Eternal Freeze. These two symbols are bound together — the gear restricting the ice. It represents the unyielding spirit of the Architects in the face of nature's barbarity.

speaker: Pela
line: Any questions~?

speaker: Pela
line: Any questions~?

text: Does the monument have any symbolic meaning?

children.speaker: Pela
children.line: The monument is made up of two parts: A gear that symbolizes knowledge and industrial strength, and huge ice crystals that symbolize the Eternal Freeze. These two symbols are bound together — the gear restricting the ice. It represents the unyielding spirit of the Architects in the face of nature's barbarity.

children.speaker: Pela
children.line: You mean, what are they made of? It's Geomarrow that's undergone a change in color. The color of Geomarrow is related to the environmental temperature during its refinement.

children.speaker: Pela
children.line: The Architects are followers of the Aeon Qlipoth. It was they that foresaw the crisis, built up our walls, and established Belobog — preserving the spark of human civilization.

children.speaker: Pela
children.line: Or to put it another way, the Architects are Belobog's founders and saviors. Even today, they are still tending to the city.

text: How did the Eternal Freeze occur?

children.speaker: Pela
children.line: That's a question for the Scientific Research Division, though they may not be able to give you a definitive answer.

children.speaker: Pela
children.line: The Eternal Freeze is no ordinary natural disaster — meteorological records from hundreds of years ago cannot explain the cause. To put it simply, it's a problem that has plagued Belobog scientists for centuries.

text: I don't have any more questions.

children.speaker: Pela
children.line: And what about you guys? Take your time, we're not in a rush.

text: Return to Goethe Hotel and rest

title: Mission Description
content: After an entire day of sightseeing, you've got a complete understanding of the local culture and are just an appointment at Belobog's Administrative Department away from becoming its actual citizens.It's getting late and not much more is happening on the streets. It's a good time to return to the Goethe Hotel and bring this so-far pleasant day to an end.

speaker: March 7th
line: *yawn* ...So tired. I just wanna put my head on a pillow and drift off...

speaker: March 7th
line: Seems like the first day of our trailblazing expeditions is always pretty eventful, huh Dan Heng.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Heh, that's because you've got too much energy.

speaker: March 7th
line: Wow, what a beautiful lobby! It's gonna be soft mattresses and cushiony pillows tonight!

speaker: March 7th
line: Wanna have a pillow fight later? Huh? Huh? I bet they're stuffed with goose feathers, haha!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: March, earlier in Qlipoth Fort—

speaker: March 7th
line: Stop! I know what you're gonna say: "March, you said too much back there — March, you shouldn't reveal our goal to people we don't trust..." Meanwhile you guys were beating around the bush and speaking in riddles.

speaker: March 7th
line: But check it out — seems like we landed with a pretty sweet deal, right? We get the royal treatment, rooms in a beauuuutiful hotel, and the full support of the locals! As far as trailblazing goes, this is smooth as heck!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...That's... not what I was going to say.

speaker: March 7th
line: Alright, spit it out then.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Earlier in Qlipoth Fort... were you paying attention to the Supreme Guardian ?

speaker: March 7th
line: Uhh, yeah, of course — this isn't my first expedition y'know. My powers of perception are sharper than the sharpest blade~

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Nope, she seemed normal to me. She was kinda harsh at first, but she turned out to be a nice, reasonable lady.

text: I knew there was something up with her!

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Something up with her? She seemed normal to me. She was kinda harsh at first, but she turned out to be a nice, reasonable lady.

text: ...Am I the only one that didn't notice anything?

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Nope, she seemed normal to me too. She was kinda harsh at first, but she turned out to be a nice, reasonable lady.

speaker: March 7th
line: Although... it felt like she was looking through me. As in, I know she was speaking to us, but it seemed like her gaze was fixed on something far away...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Hmm, I had a similar feeling. Almost as if we weren't the only people in the room.

speaker: March 7th
line: *gasp* Do you have to put it like that? That's scary...

text: It must've been the invisible man.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Well, there's no way he'd get past Dan Heng's sharp eyes.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Hmm, maybe. She's an important person after all — maybe there were armed bodyguards lying in ambush.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Haha, it's possible.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Perhaps I'm too sensitive... She did promise to help us. I just hope she keeps her word...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Let's get some rest, we need to save our energy for the discussions tomorrow.

title: Mission Description
content: After an entire day of sightseeing, you've got a complete understanding of the local culture and are just an appointment at Belobog's Administrative Department away from becoming its actual citizens.You return to the Goethe Hotel. The warm Geomarrow lights and the tea fragrance in the air make you feel at ease.There's still some time to walk around the hotel before washing up and getting ready for bed. It seems like March 7th and Dan Heng also want to speak to you — arrange your time before sleeping as you wish.

text: (Approach the marked area in theHotel Corridor)

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Is there anything left to do? We're meeting the guardian tomorrow. There won't be any time for sightseeing.

text: That's enough fun for today. Time to rest.
(After choosing to rest, if the Trailblazer is male)

speaker: March 7th
line: It was a long day today. All I need is a hot shower and a good night's sleep.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: *yawn* You too!

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Well don't talk about it then!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Let's get to bed early and save our energy. I sense the next few days could be tiring.

speaker: March 7th
line: Well, I'm off to my room then. Express lights off!

text: (After choosing to rest, if the Trailblazer is female)

speaker: March 7th
line: It was a long day today. All I need is a hot shower and a good night's sleep.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: *yawn* You too!

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Well don't talk about it then!

text: Didn't someone mention a pillow fight?

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Yeah! About time!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Let's get to bed early and save our energy. I sense the next few days could be tiring.

speaker: March 7th
line: Well, I'm off to my room then. Express lights off!

title: Mission Description
content: After an entire day of sightseeing, you've got a complete understanding of the local culture and are just an appointment at Belobog's Administrative Department away from becoming its actual citizens.It's finally time for sleep and you feel an uncomfortable urge to snuggle with the soft and fluffy hotel bed.Get some sleep and rest well, you deserve it — Express lights off!

speaker: Voice of the Stellaron
line: Cocolia... Cocolia...

speaker: Teenage Cocolia
line: Wh—Who are you...? ...What are you?

speaker: Voice of the Stellaron
line: We are allies... allies of the guardians through generations.

speaker: Teenage Cocolia
line: What do you want...?

speaker: Voice of the Stellaron
line: To rebuild... this dying world...

speaker: Voice of the Stellaron
line: To help you... achieve your wish.

text: (A knock is heard at the door)
Investigate the commotion outside the hotel

title: Mission Description
content: On the first night of the trailblazing expedition, you don't sleep as soundly and at ease as you did on the Express.It's not because you have some kind of close bond with the Express but because you keep hearing the sound of troops moving around as you sleep.And now, you can hear frantic door-knocking — your instincts tell you that something's not right... Go and investigate.

speaker: March 7th
line: ▶ Hey, (Trailblazer). Did you hear that?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: There's a group of Silvermane Guards at the entrance... and I don't think they're here to say hi.

speaker: March 7th
line: If this is our escort, it's less friendly than I was expecting.

text: You guys are assuming a lot. All I can see is their helmets.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: ...I just have a feeling.

text: You can't always be friendly on the job, you know.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Huh, you must've had some miserable jobs.

text: Maybe they're not here to escort us?

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: I guess we'll have to find out...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Let's go and meet them. We won't know until we're down there.

speaker: Stern Silvermane Guard
line: Hey! Commander Bronya is waiting for you all down below. Hurry up and go see her. And no tricks!

speaker: March 7th
line: Are we... in a lot of trouble?

text: Confront the Silvermane Guards outside the hotel

title: Mission Description
content: On the first night of the trailblazing expedition, you don't sleep as soundly and at ease as you did on the Express.It's not because you have some kind of close bond with the Express but because you keep hearing the sound of troops moving around as you sleep.And now, you know exactly where the noise is coming from — it's undoubtedly the doing of the noble-looking girl and her troops in front of you.They don't seem to be friendly. Go and ask them what they want.

text: (If the player moves away from the troops)

speaker: Stern Silvermane Guard
line: Suspects! Stop running around and go see Commander Bronya!

speaker: March 7th
line: Suspects!? That's not good...

speaker: March 7th
line: Huh? It's you... you were there at the Fort...

speaker: Bronya
line: I am Bronya Rand, acting commander of the Silvermane Guards. In the name of the Amber Lord in the highest, and under order of Supreme Guardian Cocolia Rand, I hereby arrest the suspected infiltrators under the charge of plotting to incite rebellion.

speaker: Bronya
line: As agent of the supreme guardian, I herewith temporarily strip you of your freedom of action and speech. When you are tried by the adjudication panel, you will be given the opportunity to defend yourselves against the accusations.

speaker: Bronya
line: Resistance will prove futile. You must come with me.

speaker: March 7th
line: W—Wait a minute! This isn't what we agreed! She said we were gonna be escorted to discuss an urgent matter!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...This is an orchestrated betrayal, obviously.

speaker: March 7th
line: Looks like we've been downgraded to accomplices... again. Seems like it's every third planet this happens.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: That's because you always act without thinking — you never have a plan.

speaker: March 7th
line: Hey, I'm improving! I'm coming up with a plan right now... aaaand... got one!

speaker: March 7th
line: ▶ (Trailblazer), Dan Heng, the alley!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The one that's been sealed off... Hmm, it's possible.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ▶ (Trailblazer), March, be ready to make an escape.

speaker: March 7th
line: Huh? Really? I just wanted to say something...

text: We should probably go with them...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Three of a kind...

text: I guess we are a strange trio...

speaker: March 7th
line: Shh! It's an old Astral Express escape signal. Do you play cards?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Two Pair...

speaker: Silvermane Guard
line: Hey, what are you whispering? Let's get going!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Ace!

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Argh, hey!

children.text:
(Dan Heng shields March 7th as the trailblazer swings their bat at a soldier)
(The soldiers move to fire their weapons at the escaping trio, but their weapons become jammed with ice)

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Have an "ice" day!

children.text: (The Trailblazer, March 7th, and Dan Heng escape into the Fragmentum)

speaker: Pela
line: They charged straight in!

speaker: Bronya
line: ...Escaping into a Fragmentum. I don't know if they're overconfident or just eager for death. It would seem that mother's judgment was correct...

speaker: Pela
line: Should we report them as missing or deceased?

speaker: Bronya
line: The supreme guardian's order was to arrest them. We cannot abandon our pursuit just because they fled into a sealed off area. I must ascertain their fate with my own eyes.

speaker: Pela
line: Y—Yes, ma'am.

speaker: Bronya
line: Eradicate all threats to Belobog's security... that is what I must do.

text: (After the Trailblazer, March 7th, and Dan Heng make their escape)

speaker: March 7th
line: Hah! See, they weren't brave enough to follow us! Freedom!

speaker: March 7th
line: Serves them right! Better luck next time, slowpokes!

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Oh please, it's the result that counts~ Gotta take risks sometimes if you wanna succeed~

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Hehe, it was a team effort~

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Well, you can get good at getting lucky~

speaker: Dan Heng
line: We caught them by surprise, nothing more. They'll be in pursuit soon enough.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Let's follow the path. We need to guarantee our own safety before making any further plans.
